intro: Sarcoglyphis hiepii, commonly known as the Hiepii's sarcoglyph, is a member of the family Cactaceae, characterized by its succulent stems and spines. It is native to arid regions of North America, particularly in the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant typically grows as a low, sprawling shrub with thick, fleshy stems that store water. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, appearing in clusters at the ends of the stems. Sarcoglyphis hiepii is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal rainfall.
